content: I am a quantitative researcher at DRW in Montreal. I graduated from the Concordia Institute for Information Systems Engineering (CIISE), where I completed my master’s thesis (M.A.Sc) under the supervision of Dr. Jia Yuan Yu. I also hold a bachor’s degree in Electrical Engineering (B.Eng) from McGill. My research interests include change point detection, operations research and financial market microstructures.

title: Tyler Manning-Dahan

content: This project explores principal component analysis and autoencoders to reduce the dimensionality of the Fashion MNIST dataset. Multinomial logistic regression is paired with each technique to classify the images.
summary: Comparison of PCA and Autoencoders with Image Data.
title: School Project

summary: Applying Kernel Change Point Detection to Financial Markets.
title: Master's Thesis
